blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: every time I reread asoiaf books I'm drown in the feels for those two
summary: [...]Jon had their father's face, as she did. They were the only ones. Robb and Sansa and Bran and even little Rickon all took...
body:
[…]Jon had their father’s face, as she did. They were the only ones. Robb and Sansa and Bran and even little Rickon all took after the Tullys, with easy smiles and fire in their hair When Arya had been little, she had been afraid that meant that she was a bastard too. It had been Jon she had gone to in her fear, and Jon who had reassured her.

Arya I - A Game of Thrones.

This is an underrated quote regarding Arya and Jon that I really love. It shows the deep mutual love that exist between those two siblings. 

When little Arya was afraid that the similar features she shared with her half brother meant that she was a bastard, she turned to Jon for comfort. It’s not like Arya was alone in the world, she could turn to plenty of other people for reassurance:to her parents, to her other siblings, to the Old Nun or any other Stark loyal subject she was close to-  but she choose Jon. And Jon didn’t disappoint her. He was able to make her feel better by reassuring her that this wasn’t the case.  This quote highlights the impact Jon has in Arya’s life. That he has been her safe harbor and he always will be. After all, years later she says so herself “ Jon will want me even if no one else will”

Moving on to Jon, I think this quote is important for both his characterization and his relationship with Arya. A young Jon was faced with his even younger beloved sister being afraid that she was a bastard like him. While I’m sure that Arya meant no harm and just turned to her older brother for comfort because she trusted him, I’m also sure that Jon would feel hurt by her  confession. After all, his bastard status is always a sensitive topic for him. However, he didn’t let that affect him and instead reacted out to make Arya feel better. This says a lot about Jon’s selflessness (a trait that he shows often towards his siblings). Also, it speaks volumes about his love for Arya. Making Arya feel better is more important to him than his discomfort.

 Seriously, I really love those two and their beautiful bond.
